title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based Thermodynamics Instructional Design Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary chemistry concepts (energy, reactions, phase changes, etc.) and secondary education experience
context.additional_context: A practice-centered program to enhance thermodynamics instructional design competencies for pre-service and in-service teachers, including training on cognitive load management strategies for complex concept delivery

learning_goals: Learners can explain how to design core thermodynamics concepts (entropy, enthalpy, laws of thermodynamics) using three or more cognitive load management techniques (sequencing, visualization, progressive complexity).
Learners can analyze real chemistry class scenarios, evaluate element interactivity levels, and propose two or more appropriate instructional strategies.
Learners can create worksheets utilizing multiple representations (text, diagrams, formulas) for solving thermodynamics problems and achieve over 80% completeness through peer evaluation.

resources: Whiteboard, markers, and thermodynamics concept card set
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
